parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To ask, request, petition, demand. Of uncertain derivation; to ask.
To drink, imbibe. A prolonged form of pio, which poo occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses; to imbibe.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A Samaritan woman. Feminine of Samareites; a Samaritess, i.e. Woman of Samaria.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To have dealings with. From sun and chraomai; to use jointly, i.e. to hold intercourse in common.
A Samaritan. From Samareia; a Samarite, i.e. Inhabitant of Samaria.
